result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey D Wegner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Forgery-Writings or Objects, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Arresting Agency: JEPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

  Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

The Court orders the Judgement of Conviction be amended to reflect the amounts and in the favor of each victim on the information submitted by St Colettas on 04-22-2015.
List of restitution owed submitted by St. Coletta

Case called at 2:02 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jeffrey D Wegner in court with Attorney Charles K. Kenyon. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Rights Compliance Verified; Upon questioning of the Court, ADA Hall indicates that no victim has individual counsel, so they State will operate in that role

Ted Behncke--sworn & testifies
--direct exam by ADA Hall
--off-record: 2:25 - 2:34 pm for Court to research matter
--cross exam by Atty Kenyon
ADA Hall orally motions for the Court to admit statements in the criminal complaint in determination of restitution amts. - No objection by Atty Kenyon

Ted Behncke--resumes stand, still under oath
--direct exam by Atty Kenyon
--Def. Exh#1-Expense Report-offered/received

Court finds that restitution is owing to: 
Andy Potter in the amount of $15
Ed O'Malley in the amount of $265
Matt Hoffman in the amount of $105
Estate of Janet Toomey in the amount of $915
Audrey Leiterman in the amount of $1620
Alec Rather in the amount of $2654.02
Jennifer Gorlick in the amount of $155
Margaret Landi in the amount of $3996.93
Angel Lachuga in the amount of $275
Ralph Derucki in the amount of $345
Victor Dunlap in the amount of $7509
Joel Newman in the amount of $55
George Thomas in the amount of $80
Vince Di Luigi in the amount of $165
Court recognizes that $669.82 remains to be credited to the numbers found by the Court. Court finds that the crediting shall be best determined by St. Coletta & directs Mr. Behnke to inform the Court, State and Atty Kenyon as to how the $669.82 has been applied to accounts. Court orders Mr. Behncke to be filed with the Court by 4:00 pm, 4/24/15. 
Atty Kenyon indicates that Mr. Wegner is not requesting a reduction in restitution due to inability to pay
Court finds that the Defendant does have a present earning & future earning ability and so Mr. Wegner will not receive a reduction in restitution for an inability to pay. 
Atty Kenyon indicates that as long as the information submitted by St. Coletta totals $669.82, then they do not request a 5 day hold before the amended JOC is completed
Court directs that the Clerk, when amending the JOC, include a note, that the Court encourages DOC to consult with Mr. Behncke or his designee prior to disbursement of any restitution, as to minimize any ill effects that may occur from disbursement. 
Recess: 3:28 pm 

NEXT: Amend JOC when information is received from St. Coletta
Restitution hearing on April 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Five statements
With elements/JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 10:30 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jeffrey D Wegner in court with Attorney Charles K. Kenyon. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall submits victim impact statement/restitution information

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #2 & #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #1, #3 & #5-#11
Court finds that Atty Kenyon has waived presentation of PSI
Recess: 10:58 am Reconvene: 11:05 am for Atty Kenyon to discuss PSI with Mr. Wegner
Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Wegner indicates that he does not wish the Court order a PSI & requests the Court accept a waiver of right to PSI
Court accepts the waiver of PSI
Statements by Brenda Isabell; Statements by Al Di Luigi; Statements Alec Rather; Statements by Ralph Derucki read by Ted Behncke; Statements by Ted Behncke
Sentencing argument by Counsel; Statements by Matt Hoffman & Amber Fleming; Statements by Ralph Derucki; Continued Sentencing Arguments by Atty Kenyon; Statements by Mr. Wegner
Recess: 12:08 pm Reconvene: 12:15 pm
ADA Hall informs the Court that during the break, did have further discussions re: restitution
Statements by Terry Hein

On Counts #2 & #4, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 4 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--To undergo any assessment and treatment required per Agent
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--Not to drink any alcohol
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or evaluations required by Agent
--To pay costs of $536 ($268 each count)
--To pay $500 DNA Surcharge ($250 each count)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To maintain current employment as he is able but is not to include the privilege of working with any vulnerable population
--No contact with St. Michael's or any of the greater gounds St. Coletta's or with any individuals of the St. Coletta Community, except if a member of the St. Coletta Community should request contact either directly or through a representative, and only with Agent approval
--Serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail (On Count #2), with Huber/Work-release privileges for NA/AA/Counseling/Employment; to commence forthwith 
--Serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail (On Count #4), with Huber/Work-release privileges for NA/AA/Counseling/Employment; to commence consecutive to Count #2
Court denies request for sentence to transfer to Rock County

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 12:47 pm 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Restitution Hearing - Send notices  **Counsel to contact JA for scheduling**
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 27, 2015 at 10:30 am.
for continuance is granted

case called at 2:05pm. [MK]
Defendant Jeffrey D Wegner in court with Attorney Charles K. Kenyon. ADA Moncia Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Plea/Sentencing Hearing today, however Attorney Kenyon indicates he is not prepared to proceed. Attorney Kenyon apologizes, indicating that he left his case file at his office and needs it to proceed.  
The Court estimates that there are approximately twenty people in the gallery, here to attend this hearing.  
The Court adjourns, informing the parties that this case will transfer to Branch III on January 1st. 
Mr. Wegner verifies that the Racine Street address remains current. 
recess 2:06pm. 

NEXT:  the case is referred to Branch III with the recommendation that a plea/sentencing hearing be scheduled (allow one hour)
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

case called at 1:30pm. 
Defendant Jeffrey D Wegner in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given. Mr. Wegner indicates that he intends to apply for Public Defender representation.
Mr. Wegner verifies that he heard the reading of the Constitutional rights by the Court.
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $10,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--not to be present on any St. Coletta property
--no direct or indirect contact with any St. Coletta residents, except for incidental contact out in the public 
--no possession or consumption of alcohol 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all medications as prescribed 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
Mr. Wegner verifies that the W. Racine Street is accurate. 
recess 1:38pm. 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/22/14 at 11:00am.  (2) schedule Preliminary Hearing on a date after the Pretrial
